definitions.definition: The state of having no job; joblessness.
The phenomenon of joblessness in an economy.
definitions.example: Unemployment has been considered a cause of crime.

definitions.definition: The level of joblessness in an economy, often measured as a percentage of the workforce.
definitions.example: Unemployment was reported at 5.2% in May, up from 4.9% in April.

definitions.definition: A type of joblessness due to a particular economic mechanism.
definitions.example: All unemployments, seasonal, frictional, cyclical, classical, whatever, mean that you're out of work.

definitions.definition: An instance or period of joblessness.
definitions.example: Until then his life had consisted of low-paying jobs, numberous unemployments, and drug use.
